page.title: 10The Royal Wedding Cont.
page.content: Wood Norton Chapel was illuminated by the light of 200 candles.The Roman Catholic Bishop of Birmingham performed the ceremony. The bride wore an embroidered dress of satin charmeuse and a point d'Angleterre bridal veil.She wore no jewellery.The bridegroom wore the uniform of the Pavian Hussars.Some of his troops were on duty at Wood Norton during the celebrations. Some of the guests stayed at Wood Norton,others stayed in Evesham or Worcester.They were taken back to London by special trains and coaches. The wedding cost the Duc d'Orleans over 30,000 and he never recovered from the expense.Films of the wedding existed but cannot be found today. Prince Charles died in 1949,Louise in 1958.They had 4 children.
